publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3863 David Whitton: Bishopbriggs Youth Café One Year Old—That the Parliament congratulates the Bishopbriggs Youth Café on its one year anniversary; notes that, in its first year of operation, the Bishopbriggs Youth Café has attracted over 150 young people as members and has a regular attendance of over 90; plays tribute to the hard work and dedication of the team of volunteers and the project leader, Jamie Davies, and notes that, in partnership with Strathclyde Police and a team of volunteers, it has provided one of the few places in Bishopbriggs for young people to meet on a regular basis. Supported by: Patricia Ferguson*, Jamie McGrigor*, Karen Whitefield*, Bill Butler*, Mary Mulligan*, Ross Finnie*, Pauline McNeill*, Jackie Baillie*, Trish Godman*, Jackson Carlaw*, Bill Kidd*, Stuart McMillan*, Sandra White*, Mr Frank McAveety*

S3M-3863 David Whitton: Bishopbriggs Youth Café One Year Old—That the Parliament congratulates the Bishopbriggs Youth Café on its one year anniversary; notes that, in its first year of operation, the Bishopbriggs Youth Café has attracted over 150 young people as members and has a regular attendance of over 90; plays tribute to the hard work and dedication of the team of volunteers and the project leader, Jamie Davies, and notes that, in partnership with Strathclyde Police and a team of volunteers, it has provided one of the few places in Bishopbriggs for young people to meet on a regular basis. Supported by: Patricia Ferguson, Jamie McGrigor, Karen Whitefield, Bill Butler, Mary Mulligan, Ross Finnie, Pauline McNeill, Jackie Baillie, Trish Godman, Jackson Carlaw, Bill Kidd, Stuart McMillan, Sandra White, Mr Frank McAveety, Ken Macintosh*, Dr Richard Simpson*, Jack McConnell*
S3M-3863 Bishopbriggs Youth Café One Year Old (lodged on 2 April 2009) Marilyn Livingstone*
S3M-3863 Bishopbriggs Youth Café One Year Old (lodged on 2 April 2009) Gil Paterson*
S3M-3863 Bishopbriggs Youth Café One Year Old (lodged on 2 April 2009) Hugh Henry*
